unnormalised: New Delhi: In a significant move, the Indian government announced a â‚¹500 crore investment in AI research on 10/11/2024. The initiative, dubbed "AI Bharat," aims to position India as a global leader in artificial intelligence, particularly in sectors like agriculture and healthcare.
normalised: New Delhi: In a significant move, the Indian government announced a rupee five hundred crore investment in A-I research on tenth november two thousand and twenty four. The initiative, dubbed "A-I Bharat," aims to position India as a global leader in artificial intelligence, particularly in sectors like agriculture and healthcare.

unnormalised: The program will fund research projects at institutions like IIT Delhi and IISc Bangalore. Key areas of focus include natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, and machine learning. The government expects "AI Bharat" to generate at least 2000 high-skilled jobs by the end of FY26.
normalised: The program will fund research projects at institutions like I-I-T Delhi and I-I-S-C Bangalore. Key areas of focus include natural language processing (N-L-P), computer vision, and machine learning. The government expects "A-I Bharat" to generate at least two thousand high-skilled jobs by the end of F-Y-twenty six.

unnormalised: According to sources at the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), the program will also focus on ethical AI development. Guidelines will be established to ensure fairness and transparency in AI applications. This is in response to growing concerns about bias in AI algorithms.
normalised: According to sources at the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), the program will also focus on ethical A-I development. Guidelines will be established to ensure fairness and transparency in A-I applications. This is in response to growing concerns about bias in A-I algorithms.

unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, secretary of MeitY, stated, "AI has the potential to transform India's economy and improve the lives of its citizens. 'AI Bharat' is our commitment to harnessing this potential responsibly." The government also plans to collaborate with foreign universities and tech companies to accelerate AI innovation.
normalised: Doctor Rajesh Kumar, secretary of MeitY, stated, "A-I has the potential to transform India's economy and improve the lives of its citizens. 'A-I Bharat' is our commitment to harnessing this potential responsibly." The government also plans to collaborate with foreign universities and tech companies to accelerate A-I innovation.

unnormalised: Experts believe that the success of "AI Bharat" hinges on the availability of skilled talent and access to high-quality data. The government is reportedly considering a national AI data strategy to address these challenges. The next phase of the program, scheduled for Q1 2025, will focus on developing AI-powered solutions for rural India.
normalised: Experts believe that the success of "A-I Bharat" hinges on the availability of skilled talent and access to high-quality data. The government is reportedly considering a national A-I data strategy to address these challenges. The next phase of the program, scheduled for Q-one two thousand and twenty five, will focus on developing A-I-powered solutions for rural India.
